msgSnippet: Just the information I needed on source folders in Eclipse! However, I m having trouble figuring out in Eclipse how to specify separate output folders for each
messageBody:
Just the information I needed on source folders in Eclipse! However, I'm
having trouble figuring out in Eclipse how to specify separate output
folders for each source folder. The help file even has just such a help
topic, but the instructions are not quite coherent (to me, anyway). Could
someone elucidate?

~~Michael Sorens


Bryce Fischer wrote:

Yagiz Erkan wrote:

> <>Hi all,
>
> I'm sure this topic must have been discussed before but I'd really
> appreciate
> your comments, or more, your personal experience concerning your test
> package
> structure. The two alternatives that I see are:
>
> 1)
> src/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClass
> src/test.mycompany.myapp.MyClassTest
>
> 2)
> src/java/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClass
> src/test/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClassTest
>
> The first one separates the packages so that the deployment is easier
> however
> there's need to import the tested classes within the test cases. The
> second one
> removes the problem of importing however, for anybody external to the
> application, the test cases suddenly make part of the final product.

Not necessarily. Most IDE's let you specify seperate output directories
for different source trees. For instance, in Eclipse you can specify 2
different Source Folders, one for src/java and another for src/test.

I use ant, and have a compile target for java src and another compile
target for test src. When I'm building for production, I'll just run the
target for java src.

> <>I'd appreciate your comments/suggestions/success stories :-) on this.
> Thanks,
